TextView.android:text: RES folder of the android application projects is basically represents the RESOURCES

There are four sub folders inside the res folder 
 
*drawable 
*layout 
*mipmap 
*values 
 
 Drawable 
It contain the image resources which is being used in the android project

 
Layout 
It contain the all XML files, in XML files we design the UI of the app

 
Mipmap 
It contain the image resource of the apk icon

 
Values 
It contain three XML files colors ,strings,styles

colors - This contain the resources of the color codes for the primary and secondary text

Strings 
A string resource provides text strings for your application with optional text styling and formatting. There are three types of resources that can provide your application with strings

 
 String resources- A string resource provides text strings for your application with optional text styling and formatting. There are three types of resources that can provide your application with strings:

 
 String- XML resource that provides a single string. 
 
String Array- XML resource that provides an array of strings. 
 
Quantity Strings (Plurals) XML resource that carries different strings for pluralization. All strings are capable of applying some styling markup and formatting arguments. For information about styling and formatting strings, see the section about Formatting and Styling.

Styles -A style resource defines the format and look for a UI.Style can be applied to an individual View (from within a layout file) or to an entire Activity or application (from within the manifest file). \n \nA style is a collection of attributes that specify the appearance for a single View.Style can specify attributes such as font color, font size, background color, and much more.
